Bathroom was super ....biggest shower ever! complementary water/soft drinks, etc...where do you find that these days??!! nice roof top bar/terrace/pool!! only slight negative was one electrical outlet didn't work. would DEFINITLEY stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel, great location (not ideal for familiies)”
Reviews.Author: Burywood
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time at this hotel, located right in the heart of San Diego's gaslamp district. We were able to walk to all the places we wanted to from here and the taxi journey to the Zoo and Seaworld was short. The hotel was not ideal for families, but if my wife and I were on a weekend break by ourselves it would be a fantastic place to stay. The roof top pool was stunning (but cold!) and the roof top bar had great views (you could almost watch a baseball game from there!). We had bar food on the roof one evening which was actually really very good. Beds are very soft.

Reviews.Title: “No way and don't take your family there”
Reviews.Author: bex r
Reviews.Content: The stay at this hotel was horrible. We had two kids with us and no one told us that the entire hotel shakes from the club on Friday and Saturday nights not to mention the house music blaring all night. The other patrons were belligerently drunk running the halls. On more than one occasion you would walk by a room and find blankets strewn in the hall with vomit from either over served or over intoxicated guests. The rooms are cold and non-private not to mention small. The shower leaked water all over the floor, when we reported it the response was, “we are having problems with our showers”. You can hear everything in the hall at all hours of the night and the cleaning of the hotel areas happens at 5am so if it’s not bad enough you were up all night from the club the vacuums start running right after. Valet parking is inconvenient and expensive. The $125.00 a night incidental charge is inconvenient to the pocketbook for any traveler on a budget. We booked this hotel for a wedding party and had to move half the attendees, absolutely not a family friendly hotel! Patrons should be warned of the incidental charges and the nature of this environment. I attempted to take my kids to the pool which is also littered with Alcohol and rude patrons upset that there were two children there. I will never stay at this hotel again and will not recommend it to any of my professional or personal contacts.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alison J
Reviews.Content: This was the worst experience I have ever had at a hotel! We stayed for a bachelorette party and had three rooms booked there. I also purchased the Bachelorette bottle service package at the Ivy rooftop bar. We had another group of girls (4) that were staying at a different hotel that were a part of Friday's bottle service festivities. They were hassled by the door men and weren't being allowed in after they gave my name and said they were there for bottle service. The problem could have been handled by calling my room and saying I needed to meet them at the door rather than embarrassing them and leaving a horrible lasting impression! So now his gripe is about wristbands. Don't you think you would have to physically get into the hotel to actually acquire one?! When I called earlier in the day to see what my party and I needed to do I was instructed to go upstairs give my name and we would receive wristbands. I do not understand how that was so difficult! So we're done with the rooftop bar and decide to get food while one of our friends that wasn't staying there takes a nap in our room. She wakes up before we get back needs air and goes outside downstairs only to be turned away when trying to come back in. She left her heels in the room because they were hurting her feet along with her purse and cell phone. She told the person working what room she came from and gave my name and still got turned away BUT not before an employee gave her a map and sent her on her way at around 330/4 AM!! Why wasn't she given the option to wait in the lobby?? We get back and see she's missing call our friends that she is staying with and they go out on the town to find her. Luckily they did but not after she got lost and had an encounter with one of the MANY homeless people that live in the area!! We were all in awe that had happened! I told a female that was helping us load our bags as we were checking out she could not believe it either BUT didn't offer to compensate me in any way. I spent a lot of money at this hotel as did our friends that stayed as well and to be treated like that is beyond belief!! My husband works for a time share company and you better believe he will be telling his potential owners about my experience!

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Surpirse!”
Reviews.Author: cnee
Reviews.Content: Bottom Line: A good mix of trendy and upscale. It's a happening place on the weekends but this only enhanced our stay. Comfortable beds. Great ammenities. Superior customer service. Celebrity sighting. This hotel is in a great location. The Andaz is very stylish and well appointed. I find the concept to be very refreshing and look forward to staying here again. The customer service was superior to any hotels we have stayed in- inlcuding the Ritz Carlton. We also saw a very handsome celebrity that was staying in the hotel- kind of exciting! Check in was a little weird- as I wasn't quite sure where the front desk was but they check you in and escort you with your luggage to your room and explain everything. Most things in the mini bar are complimentary which is so nice to have. Decent sized bottles of alcohol are available for purchase in your room as well. They have a Escalade that will take you anywhere within 2 miles of the hotel, so be sure to use it. This is a happening place at night! We counted at least 3 bars one of which was on the rooftop. They have a special elevator for guests (to go to your room OR any of the bars) so you don't have to wait in line. It was great when we were getting tired at the end of night because we would come back here and hang out for a bit and then go to bed. The pool is also a happening place during the daytime, worth going to. Shower: it is open with glass but there is a solid door on the bathroom. It's different but it didn't bother my husband and I. It actually made the room feel more spacious. The rooms are not large (which is normal for downtown hotels in any city) but despite some other reviews we did have drawers at the foot of the bed which we found adequate. Ext vs Int rooms: I requested an interior room based on previous reviews of noise and was totally bummed that there is only a view of concrete walls, so I think I'd probably request and exterior room next time. Customer Service: So good that it was noticeable (and this was before we had any issues). They were great in every capacity. When we did have an issue with our shower leaking and they fixed it once, they had to come back again. They handled it well and I was pleased. It is rare to have good customer service anywhere these days but the fact that is was obvious from the minute we checked-in was refreshing. I highly recommend Sunday brunch at Searsucker down the street. It's about a 5 minute walk on 5th street. We found it by accident while walking around, try the 'man-mosa" it was a big hit with our group. It was fantastic and fun and different! If you're hungry late night, the diner on the corner is open 24hrs and hit the spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, nice design, good food”
Reviews.Author: Oli0612
Reviews.Content: Stayed here only for one-night. Parking: valet $35/night (in and out) Internet: free Food: complimentary drinks (water, orange juice, pop, iced-tea), complimentary snacks (chips, granola bars and Toblerone); Room service food was good, but lack choices We stayed at a Large King room. Very spacey. TV was a bit far if u were to sit at the front of the bed, I had to sit at the end of the bed. Sofa was kind of useless, because its right under the TV, facing the bed. Bathroom was nice, glass shower, so DO NOT stay unless you are comfortable showering in front of whoever you are staying with. When we arrived, the check-in was quick and they served us complimentary drinks (wine, water, orange juice or pop). The front staff was also very kind in suggesting places for us to eat dinner. I am a member of the Hyatt Gold Passport, so I was happy to hear a "Welcome Home" from him. Members also get complimentary late check-out. Later that night, we asked housekeeping to send up some slippers. We got the slippers and they later phoned to make sure we did get it. Wake-up calls were on time. We asked for 2 calls (as snooze), and they called both times (I have had many experiences with hotels that somehow forget to give morning calls when requested). Overall, excellent find! Would for sure consider staying at other Andaz locations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice find”
Reviews.Author: Lisee98
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Andaz as an overflow option from the convention center. A little walk but a lovely little hotel with great service and chic rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, but tries too hard to be hip and trendy”
Reviews.Author: bwco
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business and it lived up to my expectations based on previous reviews. Staff was very friendly and I was offered a drink upon checkin. The room came with a well-stocked bar and almost all of the nonalcoholic items were complimentary. I did find a couple of things to be a little strange. First of all, the room had no drawers. I ended up putting items that could not be hung up on a shelf on the top of the closet. Since I am short, I had to step up in the closet to reach. More puzzling was the giant glass wall that separated the bedroom area from the rest of the room. There was very little space between where the wall ended and the table under the TV began. I kept imaging myself walkimg into the wall, especially half asleep. I will say that everything looked clean and modern and both the sheets and mattress were very comfortable. While the room had enough space for 1, I think it would have been cramped for a couple. My parents came out to join me at the end of the trip and stayed in a larger room. Their room was similarly furnished with one important difference - there was a glass enclosed tub/shower in the middle of the room and no, it was not frosted glass. I would have felt like an exhibitionist, although my parents said that the glass fogged over when in use, so it wasn't much of an issue for them. It did strike all of us as a little odd though. When a couple of issues came up (thermostat not working) they were handled quickly and courteously. The rooftop lounge and pool were very nice. You could see the baseball games on the big screen in the stadium. I would recommend bringing your own beverages - a thimbleful of Bailey's cost $12. Noise from the club was not an issue for me, but my parents heard it in their room. Nice hotel if your young and want to go clubbing. Probably a little too much for me.

Reviews.Title: “Super sexy boutique hotel in the downtown San Diego.”
Reviews.Author: Anemone350
Reviews.Content: A friend and I wound up at the Andaz when our original booking at another Hyatt hotel was full. The reservation agent suggested Andaz as the nearest "sister" hotel and we booked the room for our last night in San Diego. To be fair, we had no idea what the hotel looked like or where it was. Imagine our surprise when our taxi pulled up to a super sexy boutique hotel. Sleek in design, immaculate and pristine interiors, we were greeted by eye candy staff who were extremely courteous. One offered to check us in, the other whisked our bags discreetly away (our room wasn't yet available) and another made a complementary espresso for us. The rooms are amaaaazing, like something out of Wallpaper magazine. Very hip, urban and tasteful. Dark wood, iPod-friendly, LCD screens, free WiFi and a cocktail bar already set up for you to enjoy. Complementary drinks are available for you in the fridge (everything from pop, juice, cold water ... oddly the only thing not free is Gatorade) and you have a full mini-bar if you want to make your own martinis. Also available is a complementary snack tray - Pringles chips, Toblerone and granola bars. Sure, it's not Whole Foods, but it's more free food than you'd get on a airplane flight these days. For those who forget things easily, there's a menu available in your room of amenities available - at cost - through the hotel. These include a sewing kit and yes, even a vibrator. I guess you can be prepared for just about anything at the Andaz and they won't bat an eyelash. The bathroom is worth mentioning as a whole separate paragraph. The shower head is detachable and is shaped horizontally. It'd make for a great windshield wiper for your car. No bathtub, but very spacious shower. The only downside of the bathroom - gorgeous as it is - is that it is very tiny and there are no doorhooks so you're leaving your towel on the floor and all of your clothes on the floor. Please Andaz - put in a hook on your door or wall! Complementary thick plush robes are available for you in your closet. We pur ours on after our shower, even though it was summer time and arguably the wrong season to be wearing any kind of plush. We couldn't help ourselves. The grandeur of the place was so luxe! The beds were firm and probably the best ones I've slept on since the Hampton Inn and Suites. Even though we were only there for one night, we were both able to sleep really well, a testament to the mattress and pillows. Both my friend and I are pretty picky sleepers so this is not a small feat! We were sad to only have had one night at this hotel - we spent the next morning having brunch at their on-site restaurant. Fantastic waffles and great coffee. We didn't get a chance to sample their evening dinner, the on-site night club or the rooftop pool. There are two computers in the lobby area with printers so you can whip off your boarding pass on your way to check-out. The eye-candy staff usher out our bags and chase down a taxi for us and we're off to the airport, leaving behind an unexpectedly sophisticated hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a younger couple”
Reviews.Author: rose in woods
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my daughter for three nights while she was on a business trip in the area. Very nice hotel and friendly staff,very helpful. A lively musice bar scene most nights with load music till early morning. We stayed Monday-Thursday and were only bothered one evening. The rooftop pool is very shallow good only for a quick cooloff or lap swims. Great views from the top of the city. The room furniture is sparse without a dresser or really any place to put clothes other than the closet for hanging up only. No hooks in the shower area for clothes or towels as well. Very nice bed and bedding. Really great single serve coffee maker and plenty of supplies.

Reviews.Title: “Took great care of me (and zero noise!)”
Reviews.Author: Zolf
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Andaz for business during Comic-Con in a "King Loft" on the second floor. All the amenities were fantastic -- complimentary wi-fi, a selection of free in-room snacks and soft drinks (which saves hassle when you have to itemize expenses), friendly staff and a spacious and well-appointed room. Not only was the walk to the convention center easy, it was actually nice to be a few blocks out of the nexus of the crowds. Also, other reviewers complained about the noise ... I was there during maybe the busiest weekend of the year, with parties on the rooftop every night, and I didn't hear a peep. Nearby the hotel are a few convenient places to know about: 1.) Quality Social is a great bar/bistro across the street. 2.) Ben's 24/7 is a good breakfast spot at the Ramada a half-block away on Sixth Ave -- one of the only spots to grab an early breakfast. 3.) The Hub Deli is also a half-block down Sixth Ave., and it has booze, snacks and other convenience items. It's open late but doesn't sell booze after 10 pm and doesn't reopen until 8 am. One of the hosts mentioned that they installed soundproofing, which apparently did the trick. Hope that is helpful. I really enjoyed my stay at the Andaz and would return without thinking twice about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great concept, facilities, and staff...couldn't have asked for more.”
Reviews.Author: mattypw
Reviews.Content: Traveling to San Diego with a friend for pleasure, we wanted to stay at a somewhat trendy hotel, so decided on the Andaz. I have to say, my expectations were exceeded on almost every front. You could easily see the staff becoming very snobbish based on the fact that the hotel is such a hotspot, but they were pleasantly down-to-earth and "real". The hotel is home to one of the hottest nightclubs in town (on the roof deck), and hotel guests get VIP access (no cover/no waiting in line). On the flip side, this means that the music is pumping until 1am on Thu/Fri/Sat, so I would not recommend this hotel to early riders or my grandmother. But for those who are painting the town anyway, there's nothing like flashing a wristband and being whisked to the front of the line past all the local kids. The pool is located on the roof and is nice enough to be a bit of a scene during the day. You can tell that a lot of people who stay here over the weekend are celebrating something (yes, that's a bachelorette wearing a bikini and a veil in the pool). Lots of champagne drinking at all times. The rooms are stylish but not over-the-top. The bathrooms are spacious, which I always appreciate. One of those fantastic touches is that non-alcoholic drinks from the minibar are free; I don't know why, but I find it incredibly luxurious to actually enjoy things from the minibar without feeling the fiscal guilt of $5 bottles of water. The gym is small-ish but adequate with some free weights, a smith machine, and cardio equipment. One caveat (and I hope management reads this): our room had a very sharp, angular, low wooden chest of drawers at the foot of the bed that is impossible to see in the dark. At various points during the weekend, both me and my friend cut our legs on the furniture. It's just a design flaw and should be removed. Overall, a pleasant stay (aside from the bloodshed). I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyc2117
Reviews.Content: The Andaz is a very charming boutique hotel, very centrally located to several restaurants, stores, and a short walk to the convention center. The rooms are adorable-clean and comfortable, with possibly the nicest bar area I've seen in a hotel room. The staff was super helpful; when I asked where the best place to get a cab was, the concierge actually had someone from the hotel drive me where I was going (a restaurant about a half mile away).

Reviews.Title: “Looking Forward to Staying Here Again”
Reviews.Author: ggrtist
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for an overnight business trip during Memorial Day weekend and were very pleasantly surprised. We had read the mixed reviews and I was a bit hesitant at first. After all, we are not exactly rich hipsters to which it seems this hotel may attract but every staff person we came upon was extremely helpful and friendly. We checked in after a long day of working so the complimentary glass of wine was a real treat. The desk host who helped us check in also escorted us to our room (along with our bags) and since he knew it was our first time staying at the Andaz, he showed us the amenities and complimentary snacks & drinks. The room itself was very nice and clean with modern decor, a comfortable bed and a large flatscreen TV. We asked about a late checkout since we had not checked in until 10pm and he let us know that we could sign up for the Hyatt Passport program and enjoy a 2pm late check out. As far as the noise many have complained about, well we stayed at the hotel on a Saturday night and the host who checked us in mentioned we were in a quieter room and I guess we were because even though there was a long line to get into the hotel nightclub it wasn't anything that kept us awake. All in all we look forward to coming back again when we are not working, so we can further enjoy the hotel and great location near the Gaslamp Quarters.

Reviews.Title: “It just lacked the Andaz panache”
Reviews.Author: kabbalat
Reviews.Content: I visited this Andaz with high expectations. I had stayed at the Andaz at the wall street location where I was overwhelmed by the hospitality and service there. The San Diego Andaz paled in comparison. Firstly the staff was unenthusiastic Secondly the rooms were noisy and I heard broken glass at 2 am, and noise from the street. Thirdly, the boarding pass printer didnt work, and no one on staff cared enough to even try to fix it. Finally, the restaurant breakfast was expensive. When I was there the gym and pool was great but the adjacent bar area was under renovation. I know they can do better. Even though this coast's Andaz had the wine and amenities - it needs a

Reviews.Title: “This is an excellent hotel - atmosphere at weekends is superb”
Reviews.Author: NeilJC
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. We were a little apprehensive when we booked the hotel for a weekend getaway because we knew there was a nightclub at the hotel and reviews have said that it can get noisy late at night during the weekends but my wife and I had a superb time. We were double the average age of the club and wine bar clientele but we mixed well and the atmosphere and music was first class. The roof bar on weekend nights turns into a party with great music and atmosphere. We returned back to the hotel from a Wedding in San Diego at around midnight on Saturday night to find the hotel lobby full of people waiting to get on the elevators to go to the roof bar but when we told the staff that we were hotel guests they went totally out of their way to escort us to the elevator - superb, we felt like royalty . We were most impressed. The only downside was that the drinks were way overpriced; we paid $29 for 2 cocktails in the Wine Bar. Admittedly it was late Saturday night the atmosphere and music was first class. We may have stayed longer in the wine bar if the drink prices were normal. Overall a great experience. This was my first experience with staying at an Andaz (Hyatt) hotel – I will definitely search them out again – well done.

Reviews.Title: “if you are single or on business what a hotel”
Reviews.Author: mauriciok
Reviews.Content: What can I say, i took baggage with me the wife and kids.....this hotel is geared for the single traveler or singles in general.... but from the moment of arrival the service was first class..... even though it is not geared for children they set s up nicely... never felt uncomfortable....all the restaurants and clubs looked great.... the only short coming was no one came to pick up our bags at checkout time and when i wheeled them out along with 2 kids and strollers they didnt scramble to help..... which was unique because they jumped every minute for everything.... would go again with wife alone perfectly located in heart of gaslamp.... shortcoming as in all of san diego, valet parking very high... oh yeah, Rooms and bathrooms fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip felt like I was at home”
Reviews.Author: globbiztravel
Reviews.Content: I travel very frequently for work, and both domestic and international trips. I typically stay in Hyatt or Starwood hotels. This was my first time staying at the Andaz San Diego and it will certainly not be my last time. I look forward to traveling to San Diego in the future to stay at this hotel. The rooms were well appointed with hardwood floors, ceramic tile showers that made it appear you were standing among rocks in a waterfall, modern fixtures throughout. The bed was very comfortable and the layout of the room was excellent. The room included a working desk and a sitting area with couch and table. I was very surprised upon arriving to find out that the room included some free amenities; water and iced tea and some snacks for free every day. The rooftop restaurant/bar, pool and deck area was very nice as well, comfortable and inviting, and made you want to sit back with an iced cold beverage and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Can't do better than this!”
Reviews.Author: thenewt1
Reviews.Content: We adore this property, and stay whenever we are in San Diego. The rooms are chic and smart, the location can't be beat, and the place rocks. We generally travel 5* so you can put our comments in perspective. The staff is superb. Ask for Vladamir - he defines a hotel host!

Reviews.Title: “Great and hip hotel in great location with friendly staff and GREAT free extras....”
Reviews.Author: saintba
Reviews.Content: I just finished a quick 2 night business trip here. I've been doing a TON of travel all year and in the middle of traveling around with the family but I had to fly to San Diego for business and looked online and decided to book here as the rooms looked amazing online. I was just in San Diego a few weeks ago before we headed to Hawaii and we stayed in La Jolla in another Hyatt property. This time I was coming alone and wanted to stay in a hipper setting. I haven't stayed in the Gas Lamp area in many many years. I booked online directly on their website and it was quick and easy. I booked and put in my AAA # so they included breakfast daily. Unfortunately my meetings were so early and I had a hectic schedule so I never had a chance to try out the breakfast there but if you are a AAA member I suggest you book with it. I'm also a Hyatt Gold Passport member so they offered to give me a free late check-out up to 2 PM but I was leaving super early in the morning to drive back to LAX so didn't get to take advantage of it. But good to know for you Passport members. The hotel lobby is really gorgeous and really hip. They have personal managers that meet you and check you in. I did the online check-in but they still took some information and my credit card info. They are super friendly and it's cool they offer you something to drink. I usually travel with my wife so I book a King suite but I was coming alone so I booked a Queen suite but online they had an option to upgrade to a King room if it was available for $15 more per night. I opted for that and got the upgrade so stayed in the King room. The really polite guy at the check-in walked me up to my room and showed me the room. The king rooms are really beautiful. He explained that all the non-alcohol beverages are FREE. As well there were some snacks free. Here is a list of things that they didn't charge for: Still water Sparkling water Sodas Tonic Water Ice Tea Cranberry Juice Granola Bar Chocolate Bar Chips Lemonade Orange Juice Coffee and Tea This was the first time I stayed in a hotel where they had this type of set up. It was GREAT. In most places when you pay $200+ a night they charge you $5 for a bottled water or a $4 coke. I really liked this concept of offering these things free. Not only that but the next afternoon when I finished with meetings, I was in my room and a knock on the door and a really polite girl came by to ask if I wanted any more drinks so she gave me 4 bottled waters and asked me if I wanted anyone else. Just a great concept. I never ate in the hotel but they had room service and a restaurant there. There are so many restaurants in the area within walking distance. Definitely hit the Quarter Kitchen restaurant which is down the street. Beautiful restaurant and great food. The shower was really great with high pressure and rainfall from the ceiling type set up with another shower as well so you can use both if you want. Just keep in mind the shower is right in the middle of the room and you can see it from the bed so keep that in mind if you are shy traveling with someone else that you don't want to see you naked. Really cool decor and also a comfortable desk and also a sofa with a large 50' LCD TV. I didn't watch much TV as I was so busy in meetings and when I was in the room I was working. The GREAT thing that I loved is they don't nickel and dime you and charge for wi-fi. They had free wi-fi internet as well they had a cable. The signal was very strong and I ran a speediest.net and get 3 MB connection. In the lobby they have a few computers with a printer so I printed my boarding pass for my flight. Just keep in mind there isn't much privacy there but good enough for checking emails and printing stuff. Everyone was really friendly. The hotel is actually quite big. I was surprised how many rooms it has. The lobby evokes a totally different feel vs. seeing the rooms once you exit the elevator but once you get inside your room it's great. The only funny thing is the elevators always had this scent of men's cologne so they must intentionally put some odor there to smell like men's cologne. I'm moving to San Diego next month and actually bought a new car last month while I was in town. It was in storage but I used it while I was in town. The valet guys were always very quick but just keep in mind it's pricey at $35 a day. I always tipped the guys each time I came back so it can add up if you have a car. But those guys were so quick and friendly you should always give them a few bucks. FYI there is no self parking so that isn't an option. I read some complaints that said there was lots of noise. I didn't find it noisy at all but keep in mind I was there mid-week (Tuesday and Wednesday night). I was on the 6th floor in room #651 and it wasn't noisy at all. The bed was really comfortable and I didn't hear anyone else on my floor. In fact, I think the entire 2 days I only saw about 3 other guests so it doesn't seem like it's so busy during the week. Definitely I'd highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again and recommend it to my friends or clients. Really cool hotel. I travel around the world pretty much non-stop and stayed at many many places and this place definitely is a good choice for San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Andaz is a happening place”
Reviews.Author: PlanoJay
Reviews.Content: The Andaz hotel in San Diego is a recently renovated (within the past couple of year) Hyatt property that has plenty of things going on. Not only is it in the heart of the Gaslamp District of San Diego, it is also home to two bars that become transformed into the main attraction on Friday and Saturday nights for the 25-35 crowd. Being a patron of the hotel, you receive VIP access to both (or at least we did). Although my wife and I are well over the average age of the crowd, we still enjoyed ourselves - if nothing else but to people watch. The wine bar in the lobby area is a must if you enjoy sampling various wines from the area. Every single employee of the hotel went out of their way, each and every time we asked a question or needed help. Something I have not seen in a while. The staff was very welcoming the very minute we walked in the front door. The food in the hotel lobby was great (only had the breakfast each morning) and the drinks served on the rooftop bar as well as the basement bar were very accomodating; although expensive - but since the bars are very popular, what do you expect. My ONLY complaint was at breakfast time when it seemed to take an extrodiniarly long amount of time to get service, food and a check. Other than this small issue, the Andaz is a must for a vacation to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but noisy”
Reviews.Author: London230
Reviews.Content: I would have given this hotel a five star rating except for the noise issue. The hotel was of a very high standard. The food was great and the rooftop pool area excellent. The staff were wonderful - nothing was too much trouble for them. I am a woman and was travelling alone and I felt that they looked out for me and made me feel very welcome. The room I stayed in was fairly small but nicely decorated and the bed was very comfortable. My only criticisms of the room itself were that there was no drawer space for underwear (not an issue for short stays, but I was there for a week, so it bugged me) and there is no full length mirror (probably not an issue for men, but it annoyed me). My only major issue was the noise..... On the booking, a quiet room was specified and to be fair, they gave me a street facing room on the 4th floor, so I did not experience any noise from the nightclub. The problem was that the orientation of the room meant that I looked out over a nightclub and a 24hr food place and the double glazing might as well have been non existent. It was OK Tuesday through Thursday, but I was there over the Memorial Day weekend, and the noise on the other nights was awful. Earplugs helped, but by no means drowned out all the noise. I must admit that I am a light sleeper, but I feel that all but the deepest of sleepers would have had an issue. All in all, I would stay there again, but would make sure that I took my noise cancelling headphones with me next time.....

Reviews.Title: “Awsome hotel - Have already recommened it to friends”
Reviews.Author: Mike_convention_guy
Reviews.Content: If you are coming to San Diego this is a must stay Hotel. The roof top pool and bar are spectacular nwith a great view of San Diegos Gaslamp distric and the Padres ball park. The staff is always friendly and extreemly helpful. Of notable mention was Jeff S. Always there with great reccomendations for places to go and see. Always a happy stay. Mike

Reviews.Title: “Sexy Hotel, Vibrant Nighclub Scene/Wine Bar”
Reviews.Author: mongolikescandy
Reviews.Content: We left the Porto Vista in Little Italy after a disappointing stay and spent one night at the Andaz. The difference was night and day. Lobby is chic and modern, hotel staff is uniformed and SO HELPFUL. They showed us a room first, then gave us a tour of the hotel. Amazing rooftop pool/bar, beautiful wine bar and a three-story disco underground. Restaurant is also beautiful, though we didn't eat there. Room has contemporary design with nice amenities, full wet bar with free water and sodas, free wireless internet. Overnight parking is $35 per night. Complimentary Escalade to take you to local reservations. They give you a glass of wine while you wait in the lobby - yay! The only downside; it's very noisy. They get 500 people on the rooftop on the weekends, and there's a line out the lobby for young parties going into the disco and wine bar. An excellent choice if you're young and hip, would not recommend for families or older couples. Great for groups, like bachelor/ette parties. 24 hour room service. We had a blast and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: nicestay2011
Reviews.Content: The staff and thier service at the Andaz were nothing short of professional. They were full of information and their additudes were very invititing. The room was very clean and comfortable. We had breakfast in the restaraunt and I just want to recomend thier filet mingon. The only negative thing I can say is that the pool is only 3ft. deep. There were a lot of people hanging out at the pool but no one was actually in it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Customer Service & Great Location- Def Loved it”
Reviews.Author: amberCA
Reviews.Content: Anything you need- they are there to try to accommodate. Great Staff! Use of the pimped out Escalade was a definite bonus. View from the pool is great. Cocktail prices are steep but happy hour is a bargain. Beds are comfortable, sodas/waters/some snacks are complimentary, contemporary, great rooftop club but not too loud Rooms at same rate vary in size dependent on location- pro or con depending where your room is.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL AND AMAZING TEAM MEMBERS”
Reviews.Author: GregMatt1920
Reviews.Content: My partner and I styed at the Andaz San Diego for my birthday in May and were extremely impressed with not only the hotel but especially the amazing coordination and attitudes of the team members. The ease of check in and having not one but four team members refer to us by our names made us feel extremely welcome. We wanted to thank in particular, Lauren, from the front desk who went above and beyond in making our stay special. The hotel is highly recommended and is well worth it. ---Greg Aragon

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service & nightlife at the Andaz”
Reviews.Author: HipHipJorge
Reviews.Content: I live in San Diego and my friends were visiting from New York City. The expectation of the trip was definitely to get some sun and party hard. The staff at the Andaz was incredibly nice, beginning with the moment we arrived. Vlad greeted us in the lobby and gave us the rundown. Throughout the trip, he was extremely helpful, and we found that whichever staff was hanging in the lobby was always able to give great recommendations and answer questions. You couldn’t walk through the lobby without being offered complimentary wine, coffee, espresso, etc. Room was beautiful, bathrooms are great. Location is top notch, though we partied in the hotel both nights. As this hotel is not that big, they really cater to the guests who choose to participate in the club’s nightlife. The staff was extremely helpful in making sure that we got wristbands (insuring full access @ night), and the staff’s kindness was even extended to guests of our room. Even as the hotel became extremely crowded at night, the top notch customer service remained the same. All the elevator riders (tough job, dealing with drunk idiots all night) were extremely friendly. The clubs were awesome, great turnout, lots of beautiful women, plenty of options: chill on the rooftop, by the fire, upstairs dancefloor, downstairs dancefloor, etc etc. All great. Drinking at the pool during the day – staff was again, extremely attentive and helpful. That was the theme; great customer service. There is a Keurig coffee maker in each room, and that was a great treat. When we ran out, I placed a call and they had more coffee in the room within 5 minutes. Wasn’t surprising. They even have 2 Cadillac Escalades (andaz 1 & 2) that they generously offer to the guests to get to local spots. If you want to party and want a great rooftop pool, I highly recommend the Andaz. GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE. THANKS VLAD! Also should add that the entire weekend, I was hobbled by a badly sprained ankle. The staff was so helpful. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch service”
Reviews.Author: KimD7
Reviews.Content: The service from start to finish was impeccable. We were greeted by a smiling valet upon arrival and sent on our way by a courteous valet on our departure, with nothing but professionalism in between. Take advantage of the recommendations of the concierges. Each has a different view but they all steer you in the right direction. If you are looking for a quick breakfast/coffee to a 5 star dinner they were fantastic with their insight. Great restaurants/bars within walking distance, and easy launching point for exploring this wonderful city. Be it a day on coronado, the zoo, La Jolla, Torey Pines it is all readily accessible from the Andaz.

Reviews.Title: “Its refreshing to encounter such great customer service nowadays!!”
Reviews.Author: pegnraul06
Reviews.Content: Just left d hotel n cannot rave how great our wknd was! D staff extremely attentive and friendly! The location awesome d hotel was perfect! We live by la n will def b bak

Reviews.Title: “Don't bet on a good night's sleep!!”
Reviews.Author: ttangbee
Reviews.Content: Lobby, wine bar, restaurant, all modern and trendy. Stayed in the larger corner double room which was again modern, clean and trendy. But what is a hotel's main purpose? Out of all possible answers including service, comfort, cleanliness, etc., I hope most of you will agree that it is a place you go to so that you'll have a roof over your head at night for some shut eyes when you're away from home. Well, Andaz San Diego fails miserably at the basics of what a lodging's main purpose should be. This hotel's first priority is not with the hotel guests who want to rest after a long day but with the young screaming crew who frequent the night club which this hotel is notorious for. We stayed on a Thursday night (it was not even on a weekend night!!) and the noise level was out of this world. It has the thinnest walls and windows ever!! We could not get any peace from 9pm to 3am. When checking in, we asked for the most quietest room they had since she warned us that we should not be alarmed about the bodyguards standing in front of the hotel entrance due to the night club. She graciously(?) assigned us to an accessible room on the 2nd floor facing out, right above the entrance to the night club!! When we had enough and complained about the noise at 11pm, we were repeatedly asked if we were staying for one night only (not that we would ever want to stay longer), and then moved us 2 floors up but still above the entrance to the night club. Noise level went down from 10 to 9 but not enough to sleep until all the screaming and bickering came to an end at 3am. As an apology, front desk offered us free breakfast and little did we know that this would be the icing on the cake. If noise from the night before wasn't enough, they started drilling and hammering down walls right above the restaurant when there were still guests eating breakfast. By this time, we were packing and running for the doors. When asked how our stay was, I told the front desk, "Terrible. What good is 300-count European sheets and a complimentary breakfast if you cannot sleep or enjoy them?" She apologized and asked if there is anything she can do to make amends to our unpleasant experience. I asked her "What can you do?" and the reply I got made me wordless. "I don't know. I'm sorry you're not satisfied but the hotel is new and we are working on the kinks. Maybe your next stay with us would be better." Until they work out their kinks, anyone staying here has to suffer? Hmm. Sorry Andaz but we'll never stay here again and neither will any of our friends. So, if you're really insensitive to noise or you just love the vibrations of the nightclub music, stay here. Otherwise, keep away as there are too many better hotels close by that do care about their guests. A friendly suggestion to Andaz San Diego: I would recommend you benchmark Campton Place in San Francisco. Ask them what they did to minimize noise coming in from outside downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Nice, and Classy :)”
Reviews.Author: madimyluv
Reviews.Content: Andaz hotel was so nice upon entrance. The crew working there greeted me and my boyfriend with class. The hotel is very nice with a laid back elegant vibe. This hotel is very modern and up to date with everything. It does have a club underground from the hotel so it does get a lot of youngsters at night to party but if you are there to do just that you will love it! There is a roof top club as well with a full bar, lounge seats, and a pool that out looks Down Town San Diego. My boyfriend and I had so much fun and we will be going back real soon. If you are looking for a quiet hotel then this would not be the hotel for you. However, some of the reviews suggests that it was very loud and they couldnt sleep but that was not the case for us. when it was time to lay down it was very much quiet. Not sure where their room was located so maybe that could be the reason why the music from the club kept them up. Overall we had a blast and the hotel is awesome :)

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Valluc70
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a lot of hotels for business and for pleasure. This stay was for pleasure. We had a king size bed asked for a high floor. Our room was not on a high floor and was above the night club which we were not told. We heard the night club all night long. The tub and shower were in the middle of the room encased in glass. The shower leaked all over the floor and I slipped. When checking out informed the front desk and was told oh yea we know that's a problem. They claim to have a complimentary shuttle. We waited for 30 minutes on a driver who never showed up and were late to the Padres game. We called ahead to be picked up after dinner and the shuttle never came. All in all our stay was horrible and NOT worth the over 200 a night we paid.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: sarahsmom2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel and staff is incredible! Lauren and Emily were very helpful and the car service makes you feel like a celebrity! Everyone was very helpful and thorough! Traveling with a baby can be difficult, but their staff made it easy! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - very trendy”
Reviews.Author: PVB_32082_11
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel has a sexual feel. The rooms are great as well as the bar and pool on the roof. Very fun place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “A huge let down :(”
Reviews.Author: bellmsu
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to stay in this hotel. I researched for weeks to choose a hotel that would be great for my husband and I. We live in DC and were traveling there for a joint trip- a work trip for him, and a birthday trip for me. The positives: It is really clean, kept, and modern. Though the rooms are small, they are nice and trendy. Comfortable. I love the wine bar idea downstairs. being able to chose your size and sample a variety of wines is really a great idea. I loved this. The staff made the entire stay unpleasurable to me. My husband I look young and he is a marine officer (and was often wearing his uniform). They never addressed us or even spoke to us. I saw them greeting several guests as they entered- offering wine and snacks. They never once offered a thing to us (and we stayed for almost a week). I do not know what it was about us, but we felt totally neglected. When I needed help with the printer, no one seemed to care that it wasn't working. It made the whole place seem snobby and uptight which led to an unpleasant experience overall. On a side note, the valet guys were usually very nice and helpful. I would never stay here again. We spent too much money to be treated the way we were treated. I would try someplace else (unless of course you are middle-aged and wealthy-looking I guess). Sad but true.

Reviews.Title: “Definite Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyer41
Reviews.Content: I feel very ambivalent about this hotel so let me just list the pros and cons: Pros: Great location in the Gaslamp Quarter. Well-appointed room, comfortable bed, very clean, free happy hour, free snacks & sodas in room, friendly staff, great toiletries (Korres line of products). Cons: Small room (only about 3 feet of space around King-sized bed), very noisy on weekend nights, no business center, lousy view (overlooking Salvation Army) very expensive parking ($35 a night). All that being said, I would consider staying in this hotel again only on Sunday to Thursday nights. It's totally a nightclub scene on the weekends and we could hear the music quite clearly on the third floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but not for sleeping”
Reviews.Author: Greywillow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well designed and has a great location. It has an attentive staff who take excellent care of you. The problem is that on Th, Fri, and Sat night the dance club generates very loud throbbing techno-music that cannot be ignored anywhere in the hotel. We requested the quietest room available and were wide awake at 2:00 AM when it finally shut down. Yes, we are older and no, we don't dance the night away anymore, but this is not a good place to sleep on three days of the week.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good with some Rought Spots”
Reviews.Author: choth21
Reviews.Content: I completed a 1 night stay here on Friday. Upon check-in, we were given a choice of the $15 wine card or a cheese plate and a bottle of wine for our Diamond amenity. Since we were a party of two, I asked if we could have some extra funds on the wine card, to which the answer was no. In retrospect, I think I should have gotten the cheese plate and bottle of wine, since the wine bar is expensive and $15 is really only good for about 1 glass. Check-in was fine. Parking is expensive at $35/night. We used a Diamond Suite upgrade and at first was put in a "Large King." I refused this room and told the front desk this was not a suite. We were then moved to an Andaz Loft. This isn't really a suite. But since I was only there for 1 night, we took this room. We were proactively warned about the, noise from the club above which was appreciated. Even though the Andaz Loft is definitely not a suite, I liked the room. I liked the decor, layout and the bed was comfortable. I don't know what this hotel was like before the conversion to Andaz, but i think Hyatt did a good job at renovating this property. I checked out the rooftop bar/pool and the gym. Both were nice, but nothing memorable. In the evening, we went to the wine bar. There wasn't a soul there, so we had the bartender to ourselves and got some good service. In addition to trying out the wines, we got some appetizers and the pizza and cheese plate we got were very good. One word of note: make sure to only put money on the card that you are prepared to use. Any leftover money on the wine card cannot be refunded, which I was a bit upset about because I saw no reason why they couldn't provide a refund. In terms of the noise, yes it was loud. On the night we were there, it ended at about 1AM. For one or two nights, it would be ok for me and my sig other, since we are both heavy sleepers, but i definitely would not be able to take that noise every night. The next morning we had breakfast and got the best service that we ever received throughout our stay from our waitress that morning. She was very courteous and gave us carte blanche to order whatever we wanted. We gave her a nice tip. Unfortunately, at checkout, the front desk erroneously charged us for minibar charges which we did not take, and also erroneously charged us for breakfast. For some reason, it took a long time for this to be settled, and I left the hotel a bit annoyed with the staff. In summary, I'd probably come back for another short stay, but I wouldn't be able to take a weekend here because of the noise. And I definitely wouldn't waste a suite upgrade here.

Reviews.Title: “A Modern, Trendy Spot with Good Service and Pure Luxury”
Reviews.Author: highTechFool
Reviews.Content: Free turndown service, a variety of complementary snacks in each room... and a mesmerizing "glass box" shower basically in the middle of the room. Our breakfast room service was great (a little pricey) and the central Gaslamp location is central but not over-trafficked! Understated elegance with a few touches of wild luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Kewl Hip Place”
Reviews.Author: RZavala
Reviews.Content: Best roof top bar! Crashed here for concert – was great waking up and laying in the sub on the roof top. Food, room, all great. Not been here since it was the IVY Hotel – It is better now!

Reviews.Title: “Unattentive Staff”
Reviews.Author: CherylCDW
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews online about the great staff & service I chose this hotel. When we checked in room was not ready, host did not offer the "beverage" others mentioned and failed to call us on cell phone as promised when room was ready. Two hours later when we returned to hotel we were treated as if we had just wandered in. During two day stay majority of staff acted as if we were not there. Bellmen opened door once for us and no one asked how our stay was or offered assistance. They would only speak when spoken to first. Its a shame, rooms are actually nice. I don't know if they had a problem with my AAA rate or skin color.

Reviews.Title: “Bring earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: TravelLib
Reviews.Content: This was on our conference hotel list, but I have to wonder what they were thinking! The hotel is lovely--very hip, modern, and almost like a boutique hotel. My room was ready when I arrived and it was very comfortable. But at check-in, the host made a point of telling me that there was a nightclub and that music can be heard throughout the building. So I went out and bought earplugs, which did the trick. Thursday, Friday, and Saturday are nightclub nights. Sunday was blissfully quiet.

Reviews.Title: “hip and stylish”
Reviews.Author: peacepax
Reviews.Content: Loved the decor style of the hotel and service was very good. Enjoyed lounging on the rooftop pool. Had a fabulous dinner at Quarter Kitchen. This place was packed during weekend for the Ivy Nightclub, and yes during that time it does get a little loud.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting & Club Noise BEYOND LOUD in rooms”
Reviews.Author: Debblues
Reviews.Content: This is is going to be short and sweet. - Room was not ready at checkin. - Club noise is beyond loud, it was so loud that I could have had a dance party in my room! There was no warning when we checked in. There was s slight mention there "could be a little noise" when our bags were brought up after we were already in our room, but that was 10 folds an understatement. mgmt. supposedly there were no other rooms in the entire hotel to move us to and Tried to offer us with ear plugs, and a complimentary glass of wine but seriously are you kidding me? If a hotel is ready with ear plugs they know they have a BIG PROBLEM. The mgr. on duty offered us 1/2 off the room rate but it was so loud a freaking light show could have happened and you wouldn't have needed to go to the club. There was no sleep to be had. oh it gets better.... - Room: Shower was mildewy, Silver bed pillows showed stains of excrement and when I opened up a magazine I found a Q-tip stuck to one of the pages. now, Im in marketing so I thought it was some "cute" advertising method. Um no. When we told staff they were disgusted but never had the pillows removed (stayed one night) and when we checked out they were very casual about the information I had expressed. I would NEVER recommend this hotel. The staff knows there are HUGE noise issues and hide it from guests upon arrival and nothing is stated on their website as well. I guess it's better to get half a room rate than nothing at all.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: kathy1655
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our first visit to San Diego. From the moment you enter you will know you are about to experience something new and different. Check- in is with a "host" who will offer a glass of wine or beverage while you are sitting on a couch. Our room was nice with a glass walled tub which was real "cool". We enjoyed a great dinner with exceptional food and again..great service. We were there on a Saturday night so we took advantage of the really "hot" night club. Hotel guests get VIP entrance throughout the 3 floors of fun. No noise issues with us.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the noise!”
Reviews.Author: seattlesb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is suffering from an identity crisis. Over the weekends, the hotel host a disco on the roof. The noise from the disco can be heard throughout the hotel. We were on the sixth floor and could feel the music in our room. We have stayed in numerous hotels wtih roof top activities and night clubs in the hotelsm, however, we have never experience this much noise. When we booked, we were told there could be slight noise. What they should have said was that there will be extreme noise everywhere until 2 am. Our suggestion would be the avoid the noise!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel & Great Nightclub”
Reviews.Author: orangecountypig
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very clean and decent size. The lobby tries to look modern and trendy but the lighting did not work for me. Too dark and gloomy. Loved the lobby music though. The staff were good. The bell person took too long to get our bags so we had to come all the way back down from our room to get it ourselves. They weren't too busy.... they just forgot about them. The manager apologized so I didn't count it against them. Plus, the guys at Valet more than made up for it. Matt and the rest of the guys did a great job. We got complimentary rides in the hotel's Escalade to local places. The nightclub "Ivy" was great. The music was right and the crowd was there to have a good time. My only complaint was the drinks are way too expensive. Overall, it was a very good experience. I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “over the top and noisy”
Reviews.Author: mstrav1
Reviews.Content: I've been here one night and while the service is very good, the hotel itself is a bit over the top relative to the hip and trendiness. This was a Tuesday, not even a nightclub night, and I was woken at 3am to the music from either the lobby or other rooms with the welcome music on the TV still on. Not terribly loud, more white noise. I'll be at minimum moving rooms if not hotels. Stay here if you want to be dazzled but not if you are here for work and need to get a quality sleep. Good qualities: responsiveness of the staff, complimentary mini-bar items, very new and fresh looking rooms, great TV options and a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here on a weekend if you want to go to sleep before 2:00am!”
Reviews.Author: Lmg_ergo
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Great location, sophisticated rooms, nice staff. BUT they have a night club on the roof on weekends and the techno music pounds through the hotel until 2:00am. Wish they'd told us this when we were making our reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel, love the bathrooms, hate the thumping club noise”
Reviews.Author: Jno1
Reviews.Content: I've been to the Andaz 3 times. I love its boutique feel, modern decor, pool bar, and of course the bathroom/room combo. Their mega suites are awesome, with the shower the size of a room. This last time, though, the club music was out of control. At 1am we almost had to change rooms because the music from the club down below was thumping too much. I love clubs, but this was too much. Next time I am in San Diego, I will probably stay here, just not in any interior room or on the first 2 floors- too close to the noise. Also, valet takes a really long time. Even if you call before you leave your room. Be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, just leave the kids at home”
Reviews.Author: 1norcalmama
Reviews.Content: We booked through Priceline. When we pulled up, we knew something was amiss. There was a nightclub line waiting to get in.. 4 moms, 5 young children (1-9 y/o) did not appear to be their standard clientele. Staff offered to bring kids warm cookies and milk. =) Staff was very, very friendly and professional. Nightclub music was impossible to drown out. Very adult mini bar complete with toys! The kids loved the place, lots of complimentary items. Staff was really kind, and helpful when we departed for the Westin on our 2nd night. Where we all finally slept. It would be good for Priceline to have a sorting option for Adult Boutique Hotels

Reviews.Title: “Great if you want to party, terrible if you want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: SWCSydney
Reviews.Content: A very hip and cool place to stay however the noise from the nightclub is incredible. It was virtually impossible to get any sleep. I was in town on business and needed to get sleep, not party. The room I had was very small and looked into an internal courtyard. The room was clean and modern. The staff were very good and pleasant. I wouldn't stay here again unless was planning to use the nightclub for a big night. If you do want a central, modern, hip and sleep isn't a priority then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky style and over the top service!”
Reviews.Author: Siscero
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hip hotel in an excellent location in the gas lamp district with amazing service, this is the place to stay. From the moment you arrive, very friendly people great you and help you with all your needs. They offer you a beverage of your choice right away and always welcome you back as they open the door for you. Check in is a breeze. The rooms are plush with comfy pillows and bedding, amazing showers and great amenities. The roof top bar has a great view of the water, the stadium and panoramic all around. Food was great and the wine bar is a great way to taste lots of good wines. The wine host was very knowledgeable. Very close to great shopping and amazing resturaunts. Stayed with some friends and can't say enough about the customer service and comfort of the stay. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “BEST ROMANTIC GETAWAY EVER!”
Reviews.Author: bigvin45
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a fun and exotic getaway to spark up your relationship this is the place to go! Ive stayed at many hotels before and this hotel will be one i will never forget! From the beginning at the parking valet to the check in area you feel like your staying at a 5 star resort and ive stayed at many 5 star resorts in Vegas, California, and Hawaii. It is a very personal check in where the person is communicating right next to you instead of over the counter! The room is very small but the design is a very comfortable and yet elegant room and the bed is soft and cozy! I felt like a high roller especially when you have VIP access to the clubs in the hotels! They also drop off and pick you up from any location within 2 miles of the hotel in an ESCALADE on 24s!! Ive never felt so good about my investment with this hotel but if your looking to relax and have quite time this may not be the place for you. The music is loud but not loud enough to where it affected my sleep at night because i slept very well every night!! wink wink!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great service, fun and trendy atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: kj0hnsen
Reviews.Content: We got a discount through their website...it was truly a great deal! We were welcomed by very friendly valet service and the customer service in the lobby. We were offered a glass of wine while our check in took literally minutes. We were SO happy with our room! So clean! Great FREE mini-bar snacks! Overall a great experience! It was a perfect location to the gaslamp quarter in downtown, and the concierge was very helpful with recommending restaurants or sites to see. I would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Exclusive, sexy and classy - The place to stay in the Gaslamp quarter.”
Reviews.Author: Krizo
Reviews.Content: The service immediately upon our arrival felt extremely personalized, without being overbearing. The decor of the hotel is very upscale and chic and the rooms have all (and more) of the luxurious amenities you could ever dream of. The mini-bar is stocked with many free (and some extremely pricey) snacks and drinks. The hotel transforms itself into 4 nightclubs in the evening and it's like a completely different place! The rooftop pool bar hosts sexy dancers, model searches and awesome muslc. We went to a few places in SD but kept coming back here afterward because the music and atmosphere were so great. DON'T stay at this hotel if you are a light sleeper. They do provide ear plugs on demand which basically eliminates the problem and ensures a great sleep. The service on the rooftop pool patio was extremely slow and unattentive, but the server still tried to be friendly on the odd occasion when he actually came around. Overall this was a great experience but the Andaz needs to provide outstanding service consistently to uphold its image.

Reviews.Title: “party scene hook up hotel”
Reviews.Author: jjenred5
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a place to get trashed, get laid and party, this is the place for you. If you want to actually sleep, have somewhere to put your things away and have some peace and quiet, GO ELSEWHERE. They have a club in the hotel that goes full on until 2am on Friday & Saturday nights. It is impossible to block out the noise. On top of that, you have to go through a bouncer to get to your room. When the official party ends the drunken belligerent middle-aged partiers head to their rooms and continue the insanity. The rooms, while visually stylish, are incredibly small and poorly designed. No where to put your clothes away, not even a suitcase stand. In our room there was a glass wall between the bedroom and bathroom so in order not to see the person on the toilet you had to stand practically in a corner. The food and drinks were good. The beds were comfortable but I guess you would expect that in a one-night-stand-y sort of place like this.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool place, but Important understanding about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DougOzo
Reviews.Content: Things you must know about this hotel. #1 It is amazing. Very cool vibe. Beautiful modern room #2 Service is unbelievable. 2 glasses of wine as you walk in the door. Drinks and food in the rooms mini bar are complimentary (Expcept Alcohol) #3 Shower is very cool, Ambiance is very hip and cool through out the room. #4 and MOST IMPORTANT (THIS IS A NIGHT CLUB) and then a hotel! Very High end night club. If I didnt know better I would have assumed the San Diego Charger Cheerleaders were have a party on the roof. #5 The night club is outside on the roof. Thursday night begins the weekend. #6 Music pumped hard (Vegas Hard until around 1:30) #7 Dont plan on a quite night until after 1:30 #8 If you can get past the party, this place is in my top 20 places I have stayed and I travel alot. #9 If you plan on going up to the party, they treat you like kings there. All door charges are waived and you are given VIP Status. The people and the surroundings are beautiful. #10 I got it on priceline for $70 Good Luck

Reviews.Title: “Trendy & Hip but LOUD on Club Nights”
Reviews.Author: CanadaMatt
Reviews.Content: This new hotel is cool & trendy, with modern, sleek decor, flat-screen TV, free wi-fi, the ivy lounge and pool on the roof with a great happy hour, ivy wine bar on the ground floor with 80 wines in their Enomatic machines, free snacks and non-alcoholic beverages from the in-room mini-bar and a central location in the Gaslamp District. That being said, despite staying on the 4th floor, the night club is loud and goes until 2AM on Thursday, Friday, Saturday (and possibly some other nights). I thought the sound would be muffled, but to no avail. Unless you plan on staying out every night during your stay, The Keating Hotel 1/2 block away might be a better bet. You can still come to the Ivy rooftop for happy hour, nightlife etc. but if you decide to hit the sack before 2AM you'll have some peace & quiet. Also note, our room had no view to speak of, looking into an inner courtyard of the hotel and into other people's rooms. No big deal, but not much natural light if that matters.

Reviews.Title: “Andaz Sand Diego Boutique Hotel = SNOBBY Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kandiapple01
Reviews.Content: This is a long review, but its definately worth reading if you decide to stay there. (The night before I stayed at Andaz San Diego, I stayed at Andaz West Hollywood... and the two hotels are totally different. Read my review on Andaz West Hollywood) The bad 1) Worst Check In Experience I've ever encountered. We waited for 10minutes to check in. We checked in at 12pm and the hotel staff told us the room wasn't ready yet because the hotel was sold out the night before and check in technically doesn't start till 4pm. My bf and I decided to wait for a room so we can clean ourselves up before we go to the zoo. We wait till 2pm in the lobby and no front desk staff gave us an update on the rooms or offered us a drink while we waited. So we decided to go to the zoo instead of waiting for the room. At about 4:30 we got a missed call from Andaz and I called them back and it appeared that we did not check in yet, however our rooms were ready. I was confused. 2) THe hotel has a nightclub and on Friday and Saturday evenings, it is full of people ready to go dancing and drinking. We got back from the zoo dressing like tourists and we found that you do not get service if you aren't decked out in a cocktail dress with heels or in a suit. No one opened the door for us and when we walked in, the door man asked "how can I assist you today" in a tone like, ‘wtf are you guys doing here dressing like this’? The next night my boyfriend and I got dressed up to go for dinner at Nobu and we found that we got better service if we dressed up. 3) They do not cash travelers cheques. When we went to cash one of our travelers cheques, the front desk agent was confused on the cheque and he went to ask another agent and the other agent said "I don't know, I never cashed one before". So he came back with the answer, "we don’t cash travelers cheques". This is the first time that I was unable to cash a travelers cheque at a hotel that I stayed at.... 4) They offer complimentary coffee but why offer it if they don't refill it? We went to grab coffee and there was none in the pot. The front desk agent did not acknowledge us with the front empty coffee pot... but by that time my bf and I were already so disappointed with this hotel we didn't even bother asking them for more coffee. 5) When I went to go check out, the front desk agent (Phil) did not acknowledge me whatsoever. When I told him I was there to check out, he asked for my name and room. I told him my name and my room # and I told him that I would not be leaving my room till half an hour later. All he said was "Ok, your checked out". He did not greet me or asked me how my stay was, and instead I saw him on the laptop surfing when I was waiting for him to help me AND after he helped me. Five minutes later I went back to the front desk to ask them for a receipt, (I can't believe Phil didn't even offer me a copy of my receipt) and another check in agent help me. He told me that I was not checked out yet. UNBLIEVEABLE!!!!!! Apparently Phil did not check me out. (I was so upset, I asked the check in agent what his name was, and that how I know his name was Phil.) LOUD LOUD LOUD! We stayed there from Saturday to Monday. Saturday was horrible. When I was heading back to my room at 12:30am I saw a girl, drunk out of her mind, crawling in the middle of the hallway and screaming to someone to open the door room. My boyfriend heard people slamming the walls while he was sleeping. The hotel staff were very snobby, unprofessional and stuck up. They gave us a feeling like - you should tip me for opening the door for you, or you don't belong to this hotel because you are wearing shorts and a t shirt. This hotel is not catered to tourists but to locals who like to get dressed up and go to the Ivy Lounge and get really drunk and make loud noises in the hallways. The Good 1. Location was awesome. Central. Close to 5th Ave where all many restaurants and boutiques were. 2. Clean. Hotel was very clean and trendy. 3. Complimentary mini bar in your room which includes pop, juice and 1 can of small pringles and 1 Hersey Chocolate bar and one health bar. Complimentary wine between 6pm-11pm. Complimentary coffee and baked goods in the morning but they don't refill it quickly. 4. They offer a complimentary ride 2 miles within the hotel. But the services just terrible I didn’t want to sit in a car with the workers. 5. Very soft robes.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST hotel experience we've ever had!”
Reviews.Author: tonyurban01
Reviews.Content: The girlfriend and I decided to take a little getaway to SD to finish out the summer. We had been to the rooftop pool at the Ivy around the same time last year and decided to stay there since we would end up at the rooftop pool anyway no matter where we stayed. Check-in was so quick and oh so very friendly. Natasha or "Tasha" checked us in and she was absolutely amazing. Our room wasn't ready when we got there so we left our bags with her as we went up to the pool to get some drinks and some sun. About 30 minutes later, Tasha walked up to the pool and personally handed us our room keys and let us know that she had put our bags in our room. COOL RIGHT!? BTW, for those who haven't been to the Ivy (It is now called the Andaz Hotel btw for those who didn't know), it has one of the best rooftop pools we have ever been to and trust me, we've seen some all over the country. The staff there is all very nice and friendly and might I add very good-looking. The room itself was perfect for a young couple like us. Quiet, romantic (we stayed in the Andaz Large King which had a glass-enclosed tub/shower adjacent to the bed) and some of the snacks and drinks at the minibar were complimentary. The nightclub was small but had a nice Vegas-like vibe going on. Perks for staying at the hotel: the front desk gives you a wristband that allows you to get into the nightclub and rooftop club free without having to wait in line with the other 100+ people! We went back and forth to both and had a blast! I could honestly go on and on about how great this place was but I will end this review by saying one last thing. Instead of calling us a cab to the train station, the hotel drove us there in their Cadillac Escalade, compliments of the hotel. If that won't get us to go back, I don't know what else will! STAY AT THE ANDAZ!

Reviews.Title: “Fun, beautiful hotel in super location”
Reviews.Author: NorthFLJAX
Reviews.Content: As a hotel "snob" I loved this boutique hotel. Beautiful rooms, nicely appointed. Very comfortable beds and pillows. Loved the location since we were goi g to the Zoo and to see the Padres. We took cabs and did not rent a car. The roof top bar was beautiful, especially at night. We stayed on the fourth floor and it was pretty quiet other than typical city noise and celebrations after the baseball games. HELLO people complaining about noise - this is a downtown hotel in the Gas Lamp quarter. Of course there will be some noise!! HELLO people. All downtown hotels in virtually all cities charge a lot to park cars. Parking is a premium. The staff was super nice and I was happy with the Andaz

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: ctandsn
Reviews.Content: stayed here for two nights while attending a conference at the coronado. went on priceline and got a decent deal. check in was quick and front desk staff was friendly (offered water or glass of wine upon arrival). Also had refreshments and pastries at the front desk. Rooms were small but had all the amenities and very modern in design. bed was comfortable. some of the snack bar items were complimentary (water, soda, juice, chips). free internet. the bad: their night club IVY (at the top floor) opens on Thursdays and through the weekends I believe--we were in room 402 and the noise was really distracting, and likely inappropriate if you had children with you as you can actually hear people screaming profanity at times. The party lasts till about 2am so you might be kept up until then--not a problem if you were out partying yourself I guess. Although close to the gaslamp district, the hotel is next to the salvation army, so the number of homeless folks that you see can ruin the atmosphere that the hotel tries to create. parking is $30 a night, but you can find parking at the meters. We parked at a nearby parking lot (on 7th and E) for $5 overnight (until 6am, but the attendant was nice enough to extend it to 7:30am for us. We were told we can park until 12noon for $10). If you park at the meters, make sure to look at the sign on the meter as to when street cleaning will take place (some will say tues/thurs/sat, others mon/wed/friday from 3-6am). If you park at the meters during street cleaning, you can get a ticket. Overall, not a bad short stay--it is comfortable enough but not very suitable for families or people who need to rest early--especially during nights when the night club is open. Shop around if you are going with kids or if you're taking a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible...”
Reviews.Author: insertsmileyface
Reviews.Content: Hotel lost our reservation, staff were rude, room was small, room was noisy, expensive for what it was, pool noisy (with very loud sports people who thought they ruled the world - and the staff allowed them to believe they did!) This hotel, from their own reviews to the staff on duty, thought they were larger than the client. They think that because they rate themselves as "boutique" they can be rude and dismissive. Having stayed at many a 5 star hotels all over the world, I think I am able to distinguish the difference between boutique and not worth the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place. It's a party house!”
Reviews.Author: Fredrock
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here when it was still called Ivy Hotel. It's a big party house. With clubs on the ground floor and roof top. If you are not a party person, do not stay here. I wouldn't stay here with kids either. Too much sexy in this place. Sexy people all over the place. If you are a partier but want some kind of peace and quiet then request a room in the middle floor and outter room. My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary and they had our room ready with a complinentary bottle of the bubbly. They even upgraded our room. I don't know how the owners do it now but reading the review it seems like it still the same. And it's in the heart of the Gas Lamp District. We were treated very well and they always acted professional. If you talk a little slang to them they still with their professional attitude even though you know outside of work they are just ordinary cool cats. I recommended this place to my sister and her and her hubby loved that place. My co-worker stayed her during the Rock N Roll marathon and she loved the place too. And she's not much a partier either. Downside about this place the prices went up on this place. I'll come back to this place if I can afford it. I love Daygo!!

Reviews.Title: “A must stay in San Diego.”
Reviews.Author: napafiend
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I love the staff, the rooms, the restaurant - everything about it. It's absolutely gorgeous. I had the pleasure of staying at Andaz with my boyfriend. It's a fun, hip hotel in the middle of Gaslamp. Great central location. The club was awesome - the food at Quarter Kitchen was delish - everyone who helped us was courteous and lovely. Great job, Andaz. We'll be seeing you again real soon!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: Angy122705
Reviews.Content: My stay was absolutely AMAZING!!! From the moment we arrived we were greeted by the most wonderful, nice valet staff. Even though they were extremely busy when we arrived, they did not hesitate to hurry and help us out of our vehicle. We walked in to the hotel lobby and were greeted by even more nice front desk staff. The gentleman did not hesitate to ask us if we needed a drink or some water while he quickly checked us in. The check in process took only about 5 minutes and we were quickly on our way to see our room. I walked in to our suite and was absolutely amazed. The room is decorated so nice and the big screen TVs in the living room and bedroom are fantastic. I was greeted by a bouquet of balloons and cupcakes when we walked in for my birthday weekend. Little did I know I would be engaged by the end of the night. On Thursday night the roof top club opens up and when I returned from dinner that night we were greeted by the most wonderful dressed security staff. We were greeted at the front door, at the elevator entrance and to my surprise even one in the elevator. Even though we did not attend the club that night and we could hear the music some what from our room, it wasn't unbearable and too much. We fell asleep like babies in our comfortable bed.
