I honestly did not hear the music once I closed my eyes. The location of the hotel is perfect. Right in downtown in the middle of everything. I had Starbucks just a few steps away and several locations to choose from for dinner just one block away. I was very sad to leave and wished I could have stayed just another night. I recommend anyone to go a stay there and enjoy it as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “A fun, posh, San Diego hotel”
Reviews.Author: ck390
Reviews.Content: The Andaz is by far the "coolest" hotel my fiance and I have stayed at, from the posh decor to the stylish staff, everything is done to the nines here. We stayed on the suite level, so I think we avoided a lot of the noise other commenters have mentioned. Our room was exquisite, the bed was comfy, there was free wi-fi, the mini bar was loaded (with a bunch of complimentary items too!), the bathroom was clean and had really nice shampoos and lotions. The hotel is in a great location in the gaslamp district and is within walking distance of a lot of nice restaurants and attractions. The hotel even has an Escalade service that will drive you to and pick you up from wherever you need to go! Even if you don't know what to do, the friendly front desk staff have a ton of suggestions. The great service and thoughtful amenities really put our stay here over the top.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chris1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on Valentine's weekend. Check in process was quick but most of the rooms were not ready for guests at after 4 pm. There were lots of people sitting around the lobby area waiting for the room to get in, including us. At close to 5 pm, we were called that the room was ready. They gave us the wrong room when we opened the door. There were still someone's luggage in the room. Again went downstairs and was given a new room. This is after waiting around for our room close to 1 hour. The management was able to give credit and free breakfast, but I would not recommend staying here. The party on the rooftop was so loud until 2am that we could not sleep before than 2 am. If the check in time is 4 pm, we should be able to get in the room at 4pm, not at 4:55 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Fun! Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: only1aileen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I read an earlier review by someone who was disgruntled with the hotel management/staff and we booked anyway, assuming that nothing would go wrong for us since we had stayed here when it was The Ivy last year. During our second trip there was an unexpected snafu that could have derailed our entire weekend getaway--and we thought, "Oh no! That Trip Advisor review better not be accurate!" However the hotel's front desk management did everything in their power to rectify the situation--and then some! Joe Tighe didn't skip a beat in making sure that we weren't too inconvenienced by the snafu, and he quickly involved upper management (Aaron Cole) to ensure that we were comfortable with the results. From there Aaron's responsiveness, follow up/follow through, and overall attentiveness to detail and service ensured that we will be loyal fans of the Andaz San Diego. They both went above and beyond our expectations and truly made us feel like valued clientele. The location is perfect, and the ambiance at the rooftop bar and pool is superb. Had they not handled the situation they way they did, no matter how great the hotel was, we knew we would not have returned. Without hesitation we would stay here again--it's always a great time and now we know that it has the service to match!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Party, <0 Star Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SantaMonicaSteve
Reviews.Content: Not for business, and not for families, and best for singles or couples, but 5 star in every way and the best place to stay and party outside Vegas. In fact, I like it better than Vegas as a party hotel, staff is highly professional and without the 'tude. The dance party goes on and will keep you up towards 2 am on weekends, and the adult orientation is not kid friendly. But 24 hour room service, huge shower for 2, free soft drinks in mini bar, Gaslamp location, and good value through Hotwire or Priceline. This was a business visit and I could not sleep until after 2 am and had to be at the Convention Center at 7AM, and I STILL rate this hotel 5 stars, what does that tell you? They handled it really, really well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SCVMOM37
Reviews.Content: LOVED this hotel!! We were skeptical at first after reading all the reviews but after staying here LOVED IT. The staff was great and eager to offer assistance in anyway. We could hear the music from the nightclubs but it wasn't too bad, we were on the 3rd floor, they do offer ear plugs if needed ;). The hotel also offers lots of complimentary drinks and munchies. The beds were comfy and the bathroom is well-designed. The hotel is located in the heart of GasLamp and in walking distance to Horton Plaza, Petco Park and restaurants. This hotel is very stylish. The only concern really was the Nightclub music but only Thur-Saturday. We'll definitely be back for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for people who like to party.”
Reviews.Author: MastodonFarm
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly service, nice room, fantastic pool deck with a 360 degree view of downtown San Diego. The only issue is the noise on weekend nights. We had an city-facing room on the top floor and could still hear the bass booming (though it wasn't loud enough to keep us awake). I imagine it's much louder on lower floors and those facing the atrium.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience, will definetly return”
Reviews.Author: bluelava
Reviews.Content: We were there for three days on a business conference and had a wonderful time staying at Andaz.. The staff was eager to offer assistance; they looked sharp and professional. The pool was a nice little roof top one, but perfect for lounging in a lazy late morning. The gym is small but adequate for a quick workout. The maid didn't dust the desk, prob. because we have the laptop there. The nightclubs were awesome and you can't hear the noise once you get back to the room. Lots of complimentary drinks and excellent pastries in the morning. The bed is very comfy and the bathroom is well-designed. Working distance to the Horton Mall and all the wonderful restaurants and bars in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “NICE BUT VERY NOISY - SMALL ROOM”
Reviews.Author: blewpy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location and I thought the customer service was excellent. However it was not relaxing since it was very noisy all night due to the nightclub on the roof. You feel like the music is playing right outside your window. Also you can hear people yelling or talking on the microphone outside. I was looking forward to 2am when the music stopped and we finally got some restful sleep! We are young people, but this hotel was not what I expected at all - when I check into a hotel room I look forward to peace and rest and I don't want to hear the noise from the outside world. Also, the room was very small. Bathroom fan did not work so there was NO ventilation in the room which made it humid and uncomfortable after a shower. Overall a very nice place, but it's definitely a party hotel. It felt like a spring break atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Swank, Hip, and Fun!”
Reviews.Author: Diverse-Traveller81
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great! It's really geared to the young ultra hip crowd. That being said, If you plan to go to bed early and rise up early, this is NOT the place for you. I read other reviews complaining about the noise but soon realized once I arrived that their are nightclubs on the top and the bottom of the hotel. You will be encased by Noise! and on the weekends many of the clientele in neighboring rooms will most likely pre-party and then head out to the numerous bar and nightlife located in the gas lamp district.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is nice but couldn't stay there”
Reviews.Author: nvsdr
Reviews.Content: I am not sure if I should be mad at the hotel or at pricelines inability to request specific bed arrangements. Knowing that there is no guarantee for specific bed arrangements (I needed two doubles), I contacted the hotel directly to put in my requst, to which their answer was that they can put it as a request but there still were not any guarantees. We show up at 730 and receive our room which only has a queen. I request for a roll away at least and they stated that roll aways are not provided here due to fire codes but they could have extra pillows and sheets taken upto the room. Okay... so my wife and I go look at the room and the room (albeit nicely decorated) is so small there is not even enough room to lie down on the ground anywhere in the room to try and accommodate our need for more sleeping arrangements. We return downstairs and explain that this would not work and turned in the keys. The staff had no other solutions as they claimed the entire hotel was booked. We did not stay at this hotel. Maybe if there were different circumstances and all I needed was double occupancy, maybe my review could have been much more pleasant... but perhaps not. As we were checking in,another couple tried to check in moments later and they were told their room was already given away. No explanation as to why. I was out 95 dollars (not bad through priceline considering what the hotel was renting the rooms at) and we had to drive home 3 hours with 3 year old moody and tired. Thanks PRICELINE and ANDAZ for ruining what was supposed to be a nice weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Joe M
Reviews.Content: This property is modern and gorgeous! I especially love the dark hardwood floors and the incredible bathrooms. The rooftop lounge has great views of the city and is an amazing spot to view San Diego's great downtown. The area is perfect for walking...tons of nightlife and dining right out of your doorstep. If you're looking for trendy, modern chic and boutique, this is it. Special thanks to Lisa in Sales for always taking amazing care of me!

Reviews.Title: “Sexy rooms and great service.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Sexy rooms and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, forget about sleeping”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedTravelers
Reviews.Content: I had a king room and it was amazing - whoever decorated the room really did a nice job. The colors blended in nicely, there was a good sized bathroom and a clear shower between the bed and the sink. There is a couch, free internet and a fairly comfortable bed. Service downstairs is as good as it gets. When you check in, and if you are waiting for anybody, they offer you water, soft drinks or a glass of wine. They are friendly and really want to help. Unfortunately all of the positives are offset by the lousy soundproofing; it is as if whoever redesigned the rooms completely forgot that the primary purpose of a hotel is to sleep. The windows, while apparently double paned, let in all of the outside noise, even on the higher floors. There is a rooftop lounge which not only lets in all of the music sounds, but if tanything is moved (chairs, heat lamps) you hear the scraping on your ceiling until they close, which can be as late as 4:00. You even hear ithe footsteps and music in the hallways! If you don't mind the noise it certainly is a unique, fun place. If you want to sleep more than a couple of hours a night stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent adult getaway”
Reviews.Author: CCbeets
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Andaz over the Memorial Day weekend with my wife and some friends from our high school days. The rooftop club was great with incredible views of the San Diego skyline. In the morning it was converted to a small breakfast cafe that was awesome. We spent 2 1/2 hrs there in the a.m. The hotel staff was very attentive to us as guests, and did an outstanding job from the front desk, to the waiters, to the security staff at the club. The GM, Rusty Middleton, went out of his way to take care of us personally. Many thanks. We will be returning in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: whoopwhoop27
Reviews.Content: We just spent a great weekend at the Andaz Hotel. We had a great time. The room was clean and the shower was great. We would highly recommend this hotel and hope to return soon. The staff was very knowledgeable and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “HOTWIRE KNOWS BETTER BUT JUST WON'T STOP OR ADVISE”
Reviews.Author: horseracingabroad
Reviews.Content: I booked this property on Hotwire as many of you before me have done. They continue to allow their clients to book this property fully knowing that is is so far below anyone's standards for a 4 1/2 star property that it is a joke! I suffered the same fate as many before me: a room with less that 100 sq', awful valet parking service, a 100 decibel noise level in the room until 2am, followed by college freshman type behavior of the patrons until 4am, with no attempts by staff to get things under control, I really don't blame the property as much as Hotwire. The hotel does tell its regular patrons that the room will be difficult to sleep in while the club is in opertation, before they book and pay. Why can't Hotwire do this? the answer is simple. If they did so virtually no one would book. Instead, they make it an experience that almost all of us who have done so seriously regret. How much money can they possibly make off this property to so badly damage their reputation. Rate it the two stars it deserves and price it at the rates it should get - $50.00 - or better yet - don't sell it on Thursday, Friday and Saturday nights!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great, Laid-Back, Relaxing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JessicaBear
Reviews.Content: I just finished an incredibly enjoyable and relaxing 4-night stay at the Andaz San Diego. Upon first arriving, the staff impressed me with their friendliness and professionalism. I scored a cheap room through Hotwire, so I was concerned that I'd be treated like a peon instead of like royalty, but that didn't happen at all. The room was beautiful and luxurious, if a little small. There was a great mini-bar, complete with some complimentary offerings such as soda, juice, chips, chocolate, and a granola bar. The bed was super comfy, except the pillows could have been a little firmer. The shower was relaxing. The free wireless was fast and reliable. There was also an ipod dock in the room. The coffee maker yielded just okay coffee, but it did the trick. The hotel also had a great little exercise room, with a few treadmills, elliptical machines and bikes, plus a couple of weight machines. Each machine had its own television and there were complimentary headphones provided. The machines all seemed very new and in great condition. My boyfriend and I treated ourselves to room service the first night and were floored by how delicious it was. The cheeseburger and mac 'n' cheese, especially, were exceptional. The $30/night for valet service seems pricey, but luckily, I didn't bring my car. Andaz's location makes for a very walkable vacation. I easily got to the zoo, Balboa Park, the Casbah, movie theatres, and tons of restaurants and shops on foot. The hotel was exceptionally quiet. I barely even heard other people staying there. Overall, I would enthusiastically recommend this hotel to friends and would gladly stay there again, and would also try other Andaz locations.

Reviews.Title: “Don't plan to sleep!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jimdav
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice if you are in your twenties and plan on partying at the club on the roof then in your room till 5am! Not nice is you try to go to sleep any time before 5am. Vallet are rude and will not move traffic along. We had a room with a suite door and the young girls sahring that common door salmed it all night. Nice rooms but could use some serious sound proofing!

Reviews.Title: “Classy innovative concept”
Reviews.Author: qkslvr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Thursday prior to a cruise using priceline.com. Andaz is a Hyatt property, and is a unique experience. They don't use a traditional front desk, the concierge/hosts check you in by laptop/tablet PC. They offer complimentary wine on check-in, and have a lot of complimentary items in the mini bar, as well as free wifi and wifi laptops available for guest use in the lobby. The rooms were very nice, ours had a nice glassed in large tub/ shower combo with nice toiletries, as well as a panel to provide privacy between the shower and sleeping area. Our other family members mentioned that their room had no privacy from the shower to the room. There was a nice 42" flat panel tv and ipod dock, as well as a desk and side chair. The curtains were very thin, but our room had a blackout shade behind the curtain to keep the morning light out. The hosts were very friendly, asked us to come down for free wine, and helped us with local restaurant choices. Location is in the GasLamp District, so we were within walking distance to many great restaurants. We didn't notice any of the noise others have mentioned, we had a corner room on the fifth floor. We didn't use the hotel bar or restaurant, but the by the glass wine bar looked very enticing. The rooftop pool area waas very secluded, and there were great sitting areas on the rooftop. It was a steal at my priceline bid of $71, and it is a great value at 4 star prices.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Customer Service, Terrible Value =(”
Reviews.Author: nellie554
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Tuesday and stayed for 2 nights because we couldn't get a refund from hotwire who claimed that the hotel is a 4.5/5 star rating when in reality this place would be LUCKY to be rated at 3 stars. The lobby is small dark and dingy. You spend $30/day for valet who are very slow to bring your car to the front. The rooms are so small only a queen bed and an old chipped and beat down desk fit in them. Walls are chipped and dirty, carpet is unraveling at the edges, TV is next to impossible to use, and internet is slower than molasses. Bed was so old and stiff my back hurt all the next day. There was a HUGE dead spider in the room and several stains on the filthy bed cushions. The "curtain' is very cheap and thin so don't expect to be able to sleep in as it doesn't keep any light out in the morning. The worst part of this hotel is how overpriced yet crappy everything is in addition to the EXTREMLY RUDE STAFF!! When we got there we wanted to get a refund and get the heck outta there so I called hotwire who called the hotel to see if they would let us leave and Courtney (a girl that works at the hotel) was extremely rude and snapped at me about not calling her first instead of Hotwire. She basically said that we were lying about everything so we could leave and refused to give us a refund (probably because hardly anyone was staying there and they have had a lot of lay offs recently according to the bell boy). She was the RUDEST staff person I have ever dealt with at a hotel in all my life!! The hotel is SUPER CHEAP for example, we called and asked for 2 water bottles one morning which are supposed to be complimentary but they wouldn't give them to us because we are only supposed to get 2 per day even though we hadn't gotten any that day yet. They also never refilled ouR mini bar when they were supposed to and the shampoo/conditioner they supply is so cheap and chalky that it made my hair look worse than it had before the shower! Everyone at this pathetic and outdated hotel has an attitude and made our stay horrible. A staff member told us that the hotel had been a "5 star hotel" years ago but things have drastically

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service, uncomfortable rooms, disappointing general manager!”
Reviews.Author: jcro1495
Reviews.Content: I booked through Hotwire. I accidentally booked the wrong nights and the assistant manager with hotwire on the phone agreed to a reduced rate for 2 nights. The Andaz still received my hotwire payment and we agreed I would pay the difference since it was my mistake. I reiterated with the assistant manager I was traveling on business and needed to stay within a specific rate. Thought everything was OK since 2 colleagues recieved hotwire rates even much lower. Instead I was hassled and basically told I was a liar about the agreed upon rate by the general manager. On my second day I was contacted to leave the hotel 3 times. I explained I booked for 2 nights and confirmed again my rate. Upon leaving the general manager looked at the note about my rate, noticed the exact agreed upon amount I mentioned yet INSISTED there was a mistake. I told him I was responsible for the amount above my already paid hotwire and he said the assistant manager who was not there should not have provided my lower rate. He then proceeded to bill me over $100 ABOVE the rate HE SAW IN THE COMPUTER SYSTEM. When I approached him about this twice he said the assistant manager was not there and that until he figured out why I received such a low rate he would be forced to charge my credit card. I mentioned again my two colleagues actually stayed through hotwire for a rate even lower and that I was willing to pay more just not the $100 more he was trying to charge me. I also mentioned hotwire was on the phone to confirm and he even has a note in system with the agreed upon rate. He said it is "complicated" because the manager should not have had the authority to do this. Essentially after the second time I stated it is an internal problem with the hotel and that he was essentially saying he did not believe the other managers note. His response was that he would not bill my credit card until later that day and confirm with the manager. So when I left I was charged over $100 above what was agreed and he wasted over 30 minutes of my time trying to explain this. I had an afternoon business meeting and left without continuing to argue since it was clear he was going to charge my card anyway. Terrible customer service. In addition the hotel was not that great. The bathroom is weird and the shower points straight at your face so I basically had to duck to wash my hair. The entire hotel is very snooty. On the first night at the supposed "hot spot" rooftop bar the bartender told us the next night would be "off" and the greatest place in San Diego and there would be a line, but since we were in the hotel we would be good with wristbands. Well good thing we had wristbands for the lame 25 person scene the next night. When we asked him he was like, well come back on the weekend sorry! The entire hotel is run by rude want to be black suit wearing wannabe New York nightclub bouncers.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for singles, not families”
Reviews.Author: theallens04
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night with my husband and my 11 month old son. The hotel is in a great location, easy walk to many destinations. Nightly parking was $30, a little pricey. The hotel is very trendy, rooms are super clean, bed was very comfortable. The negative was that we were given a room off of the atrium where the music/nightclub started at 9 pm and went until 1:30am. It was very loud...I couldn't get my son to sleep with the noise. I called the front desk and they said they were sold out and could not move us. Also, the room we were given had a see thru bathroom. the wall to the bathroom was glass, so when either of us went to the bathroom or shower...it was seen by the other. My son is young so he didn't get it...but toddler or older kids...I wouldnt have been happy about it. If you are single and want to party this is the place for you, but for a family..I'd say check out other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of freebies”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Drew2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with colleagues for a conference and my boss booked three rooms for five people on hotwire for something like $90/room/night. Considering the going rate was about three times that amount, we got a very good deal. We were pleasantly surprised when the rooms did not have glass walls around the bathroom. All three of our rooms were king beds for five colleagues, so sharing beds was enough for us. I agree with many of the other reviews about the service, noise, rooms, etc. One thing that is very impressive is the amount of things that are "complimentary." There are two computers in the lobby for you to check email and there is free wireless throughout the property. They have a happy hour with wine from 5pm to 6pm. There is coffee and pastries in the morning. About half of the things in the minibar in the room are complimentary including water, juice, candy, and snacks. The minibar even has an erotic kit thing. I can only imagine what is in it. The toiletries in the bathroom were excellent and there were lots of little packets of creams and lotions that smelled really nice. Of course the only drawback was the noise from the club downstairs. The rooftop party space was closed because of the rain. Since we hotwired the rooms we were given low, third floor inside rooms all around the small atrium that opens to the club. I had ear plugs in and the music was still loud. I didn't fall asleep until the music stopped around 2:00am I think. I certainly wouldn't pay the going rate to stay at this place again and if I did I would make sure that it was indeed a quiet room. If you have a car, be prepared to pay $30/day for valet. There is no self-parking.

Reviews.Title: “Unknown Commodity”
Reviews.Author: trojanking
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 day stay at the San Diego Andaz Hotel. Since we had never been to the Gaslamp District and did not have a hotel preference, we decided to try the Hotwire Service which allows you to pick a hotel rating but not a hotel. The rub is that you get a great value, but cannot select the hotel other than location and quality, however, once you select (and pay) you cannot rescind your offer. When I plugged in my 4.5 star request and saw that we were booked at the Andaz, I was a bit dismayed. Afterall, the customer rating and the reviews were mixed. I can now say that this was definitely a 4 (or 4.5) star experience and not just because I got a great deal. I would say that even at $200-250 per night it would have been worth it. Why? Great service, location and staff. The little freebies (snacks, sodas, water, internet and the friendly free upgrade we received on our second room). And, the incredible rooftop pool and bar. What doesn't work? The standard rooms are exceptionally small and the winebar is dark and uninviting unless you are on a date. One final comment: We were there at the beginning of the week when the nightclub is closed. Most of the negative comments are relating to the lack of sleep due to the booming nightclub music. That may be the case, but at least you are forewarned.

Reviews.Title: “No Rest for The Wicked or anyone else for that matter!!”
Reviews.Author: VP-travel-club
Reviews.Content: We had spent a week at the Del and moved to the Ivy for the last night before flying out to Mexico. We thought what a beautiful, modern hotel. Loved the bathrooms, etc. Until the music started. It was like your bed was on the dance floor, even with ear plugs there was no hope of sleep. The bass pounding interfered with your heart beat. I wish I had check Tripadvisor first!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location, but not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: jay379
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a Saturday-Monday a few weeks ago and I really had a great time at this hotel. There is some high and low points to this hotel and I can see it will not be for everyone, but I wanted to share my experience. STAFF: My girlfriend and I pulled up to the valet and were instantly greeted by a friendly attendant. Check in was a breeze: The staff noticed I was a Gold Hyatt Member and offered me a complimentary 2p check out (I didn't end up using it, but was quite happy with the offer). The staff escorted us up to our room and gave us all the instructions on using their complimentary Cadillac Escalade service and setting up a time for us to pick up our VIP passes for the club (included with the room). We ended up taking up the offer on the Cadillac service to and from a restaurant in down town and had great drivers that saved us the hassle of walking or cabbing, well worth giving them a tip! Location: The hotel is right in the heart of Gas Lamp. Tons of great restaurants, pubs and nightlife to get yourself into. We did end up at the roof top club of the hotel. It was a great time, but the drink prices were RIDICULOUS. A mixed cocktail (Crown & Coke) is around 12-15 bucks so most of our drinking happened before the club. However, if you are here to party on a Friday/Saturday night, it is well worth checking it out. Room: I was not a big fan of the room. We were in an Andaz Queen and it was real cramped (see pictures). The bathroom was also real compact and for some reason there was an open hole towel holder on the glass of the shower. This caused the whole bathroom to get full of water whenever we used the shower. I'm not sure about the other rooms, but I would probably consider trying to upgrade to a King if I stayed here again. Surprisingly, I did not here any noise like other reviewers from the night club. I think it all depends on where you are located in the hotel and we were on the 3rd floor. The room did come with some complimentary soft drinks and bath robes in the closet. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends or another couple, but would not recommend it for my parents or a business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Fun, Function is another story”
Reviews.Author: sosweho
Reviews.Content: The newly-rebranded Andaz San Diego is in the heart of San Diego's Gaslamp Quarter nightlife district, and is a destination for the cool and the hip. While the Hyatt-owned nameplate cometes with the established W brand, it does not feel like a copycat. If you're on business or traveling with family, there may be better options in downtown, but if you are single or a couple, it is definitely worth a visit. The rooftop pool turns into a rocking bar at night, making the hotel lobby feel more nightclub than hotel, and there can be noise from other bars and clubs in the neighborhood. A warning to anyone traveling with non-romantic interests: the Andaz has showers are all-class boxes that open into the bedroom, so there is no privacy. On the positive side, soft drinks, snacks and wifi are complimentary, and they do put the hotel guests first.

Reviews.Title: “Worth considering if staying Sun-Tues”
Reviews.Author: Davies83
Reviews.Content: As already mentioned, problems with noise make Andaz a no go-er for most people travelling over a weekend. We had no issues with this except for Wednesday night, which was due to a nearby club rather than the hotel itself. Worth noting that we were on a room facing the street so I'm not sure if other rooms would prevent against this. Pluses: location: easy walking distance into Gaslamp; lots of free snacks and drinks in the mini bar topped up daily; good bathroom (big bath) and size of room; nice pool and rooftop bar (which was virtually deserted when we went on a Monday); Free wireless; Everyone was helpful but it felt like there were a lot of staff with not much to do in the week. Minuses: Clubby feel of the lobby not my idea of stylish, smells strongly of aftershave in the elevators! If you know you're staying midweek and can get a get online deal as we did, then it's definitely a worthwhile Gaslamp option to consider. Otherwise you're probably better off elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A nightclub...not a hotel”
Reviews.Author: eyechip
Reviews.Content: What a shame...a great restaurant and exceptional rooms are completely lost to the fact that this is not a hotel. It is a luxury youth hostel nightclub that anyone wishing to actually sleep will greatly regret. I ended up checking out of a very comfortable suite at 11:00PM and leaving to an inferior product at Se Hotel which was at the very least quiet. Go ahead...be lured in...but if the rooftop nightclub is open you will be subjected to a thumping bass drum of hell like you have never imagined. Don't believe this and all the other reviews here stating the same? Give it a go...if you are not driven crazy by the noise you are either deaf or 18.

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy”
Reviews.Author: hk283
Reviews.Content: Yes, we were warned, but this is basically 3 nightclubs with a hotel built around it. It's pretty noisy. If you're 21-25 and want to do nothing but party, good place to stay. Otherwise, it's loud and the rooms are Euro-styled, with a bath/shower in the middle of the room that leaks. Not an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: luvztravel2010
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Perfect location in the gas lamp area... service was amazing! Would definitly come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect to sleep”
Reviews.Author: DelMarBlonde
Reviews.Content: Unless you're coming here for an all-night rave/bachelor party the Anadz aka Ivy Hotel is a very bad choice. We stayed here on Valentine's Day - well, I should say we TRIED to stay here. We ended up checking out at 9:30 PM because once the roof top club started up, we knew there was no romance or sleep happening for us. Fortunately we are locals and could just drive home but it was certainly disappointing/angering. The front desk took care of refunding our stay and parking fee right away and offered us free drinks at the bar (which we declined). So at least it was handled well. But her explanation of "this hotel offers a night-club feel" is a sad understatement of the truth: the hotel IS a night-club. Unless you don't plan to go to sleep until after 2 AM (and have $300 to spend on it), I'd strongly recommend staying elsewhere. The decor is nice and location is great as are aspects of the service so that's why I'm giving it 2 stars instead of 1. There is a bartender at the lounge bar (first floor) that I was very impressed with - his name is Chris, even if you're not staying at the hotel I'd go in and see him for a drink. Also points off for a key-card fiasco at check-in that stranded many people trying to check in for hours (we didn't get into our room until 6 PM although we arrived at 3 PM, no offer to comp drinks, etc for that), and the fact that the pool/deck area on the roof which is one of the major perks of the hotel during the day allows SMOKING in all areas -- gross!

Reviews.Title: “worst treatment I've ever encountered”
Reviews.Author: dasnake87
Reviews.Content: The room, the hotel and the nightclub are very nice, However, if you plan on having people in your room after hours, I suggest you stay at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excruciatingly loud hotel”
Reviews.Author: athenaert
Reviews.Content: The hotel has three clubs and the techno music permeates the hotel rooms. At 8 pm, it is uncomfortable to not be able to hear our TV in our room because the dance music. At 1:30 am (4:30 am east coast equivalent), we were like lab rats in a sleep deprivation study.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, Disappointing, and Expensive”
Reviews.Author: OtekCA
Reviews.Content: Althougth the rooms look nice, we experienced the following problems: 1) The rooms doors are paper thin, and slam closed. We heard doors slamming closed and hallway conversations nearly all night. 2) Walls are thin. We heard guest in the adjacent room talking until 4:00am. Also, we heard people talking, and sirens on the stree outside three floors below. Normally I sleep like a rock, but not at this hotel. 3) The bath tub shown on the web site, was not in my room. No hot bubble for us. 4) The T.V. kept freezing every few minutes when we attempted to watch a movie. 5) No controllable bathroom fan. Hopefully your poop does not stink. 6) No TV guide. 7) The TV Speaker in bathrrom is too loud and can not be truned off. 8) The tiny refrigerator was packed full of drinks for sale. No room for my own stuff. $9 for a bottle of water. 9) No non-valet parking. Make sure you remove all valuables each time you drive your car. 10) Homeless people all around the neighborhood, one-way street maze with potholes. This place is over priced, noisy, and in kind of a dumpy neighborhood.

HotelInfo.Name: Andaz San Diego
HotelInfo.Address: 600 F Street, Gaslamp Quarter, San Diego, CA 92101
